turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Crisscross heart.
turn.1: What is the difference between a crisscross heart and a normal heart?
turn.2: Crisscross heart Crisscross heart is a type of congenital heart defect where the right atrium is closely associated with the left ventricle in space, and the left atrium is closely associated with the right ventricle.
turn.3: Do people usually die from this?
turn.4: Although it is classified as a defect, the criss-cross is more of a spatial anomaly than a functional one, and it is possible for the heart to have relatively normal functioning.
turn.5: Is there any other difference between the two types of hearts?
turn.6: The ventricles are rotated either clockwise or counterclockwise resulting in the twisting of their connection.
turn.8: The actual blood flow stream through the ventricles is not interrupted.
turn.9: Do people with this type of heart have any other issues?
turn.10: Crisscross heart is a very rare congenital heart defect, and results in many different symptoms, even though the heart still has the ability to perform its major function of pumping blood throughout the body.
turn.11: What are some of the symptoms?
turn.12: Individuals who have this disease will experience cyanosis which is a blue tint to the skin because of inadequate blood flow to the body, this symptom will be seen especially around the mouth.
